Guideline.html:
Anatomy

Default stepper

Stepper bridge haas fixed width of 150px and Stepper label text box has fixed width of 160px, cropping any text that goes beyond the box width

Collapsed stepper

Vertical stepper

Use Cases

All steps are clickable, unless they are disabled, or incomplete. Clicking on the step will take the users to the step, but this does not always mean that the users will be able to edit the content in the step. There can be cases where the user will be taken to the step by clicking, but nothing in the step is no longer editable. This is optional and case by case depending on the task.
All steps are linear, meaning steps require users to complete one step in order to move on to the next.

Types

Stepper

Default Stepper used for primary use.

Collapsed Stepper

Collapsed stepper used for process with large amount of content, and mobile size window.

Vertical

Used for mobile. Default will not have labels, but you can show labels if space allows.

Behavior

Steps

Once a step is complete, the step indicator will be filled with solid color and the step bridge will be colored as well from the gray.
Future steps will be disabled by default.
Completed steps are also clickable, so users can navigate through the steps with ease.

Layout

The stepper should always be at the top, and center aligned.

Error steps

Error steps occur once the step is saved/submitted/published and system detects any error. Some of the reasons are
Once a steps is complete and saved/submitted/published, the information is sent to a server or system to be validated and incorrect input(s) need to be reported back to the step.
When selections in a later step in the wizard invalidate an entry in earlier steps. Ex. You can not select a city that is not in the country you choose on step one.

Do’s and Dont’s

Have appropriate content for each step. Step titles should be short and simple.

Do not have Stepper within the steps. Each step should contain only the information related to the task in the step.

Step labels should always be simple, minimal text count and no line breaks. Text boxes are 160px fixed width

Step labels should use sentence case.
Step labels should not have line breaks/text wrap.
Step labels should not be vague but straight forward about the task

Step bridges should always be 150px width on default stepper, and 24px on collapsed.

Do not change the step bridge width. The width should be fixed and stay consistent.

Content

Casing

Step labels should be using sentence casing.

Text counts & Line break

Step labels should be simple. The step name should be in one line, minimal text count and no line breaks.
Although we do not have a set word count, as each alphabet has different width, but the words should be contained in the text box, which is 160px width.

Simple and straightforward

Step labels should explain the task in the step in the simplest and most straight forward way. Avoid vague labels such as “Done”, instead be through and use “Checkout” or “Submit information” etc

Useable Examples

Control Hub

Vertical stepper
